channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TX
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TX

item.description:
Report I-2024050050

item.title: Report E-2024070419
item.description:
Report E-2024070419

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-19T18:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-16
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LFW experienced a UN1992 19122 Lacquer Thinner Fast release from a 5-gallon metal pail. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1 gallon of product released to a 3’ x 3’ area of the concrete dock floor. The release was due to the pail falling off of the pallet as a result of improper loading. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. The impacted absorbents and damaged pail were then collected into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 50000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Vehicle was traveling south on US 181. Vehicle left the right side of the roadway due to inattention/distraction by the driver. Upon corrective action, vehicle rolled onto the passenger side and slid partially off the road. The roadway was partially blocked as a result of the crash. The tank trailer was damaged in three places resulting in a discharge of contents.

item.title: Report I-2024060043
item.description:
Report I-2024060043

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-19T18:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-06
  • City: EL PASO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: T. S. EXPEDITING SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: According to the information obtained, the following occurred. While unloading, one 2,450Ib tote was discovered leaking. Area was isolated and contractor was dispatched. GrayMar Environmental responded to perform the cleanup. Upon arrival on site, GrayMar Environmental inspected the leaking tote and determined the cap was faulty, which resulted in the release of approximately 0.5 gallon of product. Free product released to trailer floor and dock at customer location. GrayMar Environmental used absorbent material and rags to wipe the area clean, and transferred the leaking tote into a recovery tote to be sent on to the consignee. One 55-gallon drum of spent absorbent and cleanup debris was generated during the cleanup. Product was contained to an impervious surface and did not impact soil or threaten to impact state waters. There were no injuries or exposures reported.

item.title: Report E-2024070372
item.description:
Report E-2024070372

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-18T15:13:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-13
  • City: MANVEL
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 14, 2024, at 2057 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Manvel, Texas regarding the release of Hydrochloric Acid. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors investigated and confirmed that there was residual impact to a 4ft x 8ft area of the trailer floor caused by the previous release of 1 quart of HYDROCHLORIC ACID (UN1789, 8, II) from (1) 1-gallon jug. Contractors neutralized then cleaned the impacted area with absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste was containerized in (1) 55-gallon DF and taken offsite by contractors for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024070315
item.description:
Report E-2024070315

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-18T15:13:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-08
  • City: LAREDO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 8, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1219 was punctured by a faulty pallet and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from E3 Environmental (E3) to remediate the impacted site. The crew placed the damaged jug in one (1) 55-gallon drum. E3 personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted debris was collected in one (1) 5-gallon pail.

item.title: Report I-2024060070
item.description:
Report I-2024060070

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-18T15:13:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-14
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: PORT TERMINAL RAILROAD ASSOCIATION (INC)
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At approximately 12:16 PM on 06/14/24 notification was received that the tank car was leaking product (Diesel Fuel) from the manway. The car was isolated in track 1 at North Yard and we immediately contacted our Haz-Mat Contractor M&M Protection LLC to respond. Upon arrival it was noted that the swing bolts were less than tool tight and there was no rim gasket. These issues were immediately corrected by M&M and the leak was stopped.

item.title: Report I-2024060046
item.description:
Report I-2024060046

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-18T15:13:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-09
  • City: PASADENA
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: PORT TERMINAL RAILROAD ASSOCIATION (INC)
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At approximately 04:36 AM on 06/09/24 notification was received that the tank car was leaking product (Argon Gas) from the valve on the vent pipe. The car was located on the south end of our Pasadena Yard and we immediately contacted our Haz-Mat Contractor M&M Protection LLC to respond. Upon arrival it was noted that the road isolation valve was in the open position and the gas line closed with the equalizer open as well as the liquid vaporizer sample line was left open. These issues were immediately corrected by M&M and the leak was stopped.

item.title: Report X-2024070974
item.description:
Report X-2024070974

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-17T18:15:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-15
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was found in QA damage area wet and torn inside of thick Hazmat bags. Upon inspection, one cap was not completely tight. No active leakage was observed but bottles were wet on the outside and one appeared slightly less full than the others. Spilled liquid tested as pH 12-13. Attached is ISF with photos as well as tracking information showing that no code 96 was applied making this an unprocessed Hazmat.

item.title: Report X-2024071002
item.description:
Report X-2024071002

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-17T18:15:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-10
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was found wet near a load door. Shipping label was only half legible. Tracking number or barcode were not visible. Tracking number was found matching the package to SPIDR images. Box, shipper, recipient and weight were matched to package with images. 2 bottles of chlorinating liquid were inside the box. 1 was crushed and half empty. Both were soiled. No hazard diamonds or markings were seen on outer box.

item.title: Report E-2024070299
item.description:
Report E-2024070299

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-17T18:15:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-05
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 5, 2024, one (1) 20-pound box of UN2277 was damaged by a nail and released approximately twenty (20) pounds of product to the truck interior. The monomer product experienced a polymerization reaction and damaged additional containers. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. Crews observed heat and vapor created from the polymerization process and contained and isolated the reacting product. All product was containerized into thirteen (13) 55-gallon vented poly drums. LSH utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted trailer and dock. All impacted debris and PPE were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The car was reported venting from the manway at 02:50 AM on 06/26/24, we immediately contacted our Haz-Mat Contractor M&M Protection to address the issue. Upon inspection, M&M identified that one (1) of the eight (8) swing bolts was not attached to the car and therefore was unable to be tightened down, allowing the product to vent from that area of the manway cover.

All 4 one gallon metal paint cans inside were soiled by black paint. The lid was off of one of the cans. Attached is the FTRACK main page and additional info page showing that no code 96 was applied and commodity information is not in system. Flammable liquid hazard diamond and UN1263 paint were seen on outer box.

  • Description: It was reported that 48-ounces of UN 1987, Leather dye released from a carton containing 12 bottles due to being crushed under heavier cargo during transit. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and he felt confident cleaning the spill with absorbents and containerizing the waste into a 5-gallon poly drum for disposal.
